page.title: 16CHEMSTAR FIRE
page.content: At about midnight on 6th September 1981 the residents of Carrbrook Village, Stalybridge, Cheshire were awakened by a series of loud explosions. As they rushed to their doors to investigate they saw the sky lit up by what appeared to be a gigantic fireworks display; objects were being thrown into the air and exploding, cascading their fiery contents over the surrounding houses. Police evacuated people from the area as deadly fumes from the fire, at the Chemstar Chemical Works, spread across the Village. The fire was only one of many to occur around this time and great concern was expressed that such dangerous chemicals should be stored in densely populated areas.
